channel.title: LibreNMS Notifications
channel.description: RSS feed for notifications to LibreNMS users

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is the first notification. We will post these whenever an upcoming major change is about to happen.

item.title: Cisco syslog parsing changes
item.description: We have overhauled the Cisco syslog parsing. Please monitor your syslog entries from Cisco IOS, IOSXR, and CatOS devices. If you notice any issues please open a new issue on GitHub and include the original syslog message.

item.title: Billing Data Changes
item.description: We have updated the method for storing billing data, removing a lot of information stored in the database which was not used. Please check that your billing data is updating as expected, and if you notice any problems open an issue on GitHub.

item.title: Introduction of default purge interval or alert history
item.description: We have introduced a purge setting for alert history which is set to 365 days as default. If you would like to update this then please set $config['alert_log_purge'] to a custom value (set in days).

item.title: The Alerts Menu has moved
item.description: The Alerts menu has been relocated to a top level menu on the far right. To make room for this, Plugins have been moved to the overview menu.

item.title: Wireless Section in Beta
item.description: The new wireless section is under development. Please visit our community to discuss these changes and help improve LibreNMS. https://t.libren.ms/5fglp

item.title: Update to alerting to normal users
item.description: We have released an update to fix normal users receiving alerts with no ability to turn this off. An option is now available within the General alert settings section to enable this. Please note that the default is off to match with the other default contact settings. If you expect normal users to receive alerts then you should enable this new option.

item.title: Legacy Alert Templates and Transports removed
item.description: As described previously, Legacy Alert Templates and Transports have been removed. You can find more info here: https://community.librenms.org/t/deprecation-notice-alerting-legacy-transports-and-templates/5915

item.title: Cisco Temperature Sensor Threshold Values Stored as High Limits
item.description: During discovery, some temperature sensors discovered on Cisco devices had their highest temperature value stored as warning high limit. For new discovered devices, this value is now stored as high limit.

item.title: LibreNMS Python Dispatcher Service V2 (breaking change)
item.description: Version two of the LibreNMS python dispatcher service is merged. This code now requires Redis 5.x and redis-py 3.x to operate (if using distributed polling). If you are using the dispatcher service with Redis and have not updated, polling will stop functioning.

item.title: RutOS 2xx pinState renamed
item.description: RutOS 2xx pinState renamed to rutos2xx_pinState. Update any alert rules you may have.

item.title: Cisco Wireless Controller classified as Wireless
item.description: Cisco WLC is now classified as type "Wireless" instead of "Network". Update any alert rules you may have.

item.title: nobulk is now called snmp_bulk
item.description: The config option "nobulk" is now called "snmp_bulk" to align better with other options. Update any local configs you might have. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/13098 for more information

item.title: Mikrotik routeros wireless changes
item.description: Improvements to routeros wireless polling will lose historical data for 60GHz rate, frequency, and distance wireless sensors. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/12976 for more information.

item.title: ADSL discovery and polling moved to a new module
item.description: Adsl statistics are now discovered and polled in a new module. Vdsl stats were also added. `lnms config:set enable_ports_adsl true`is not supported anymore. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/14207 for more information.

item.title: Memcached application compatibility break
item.description: Due to a security vulnerability, you must upgrade your memcached application scripts to the latest version. (1.1)

item.title: Manually set port speeds reset
item.description: Due to a bug, all manually set port speeds will need to be reconfigured. Likely they are set to 1 instead of the expected value. See https://github.com/librenms/librenms/pull/15238 for more information.

item.title: Alerting packet loss macro
item.description: The packet loss macros were broken recently. The quick fix is to have them resemble device up/down, which is similar to how they would function if fping_options.count=1. Hopefully, they can be fixed in the future, but be aware their functionality is degraded in the meantime.
